alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Bastrop; Blanco; Burnet; Caldwell; Comal; Edwards; Gillespie; Hays; Kendall; Kerr; Lee; Llano; Real; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 04 at 3:07AM CST until February 04 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Hazardous travel conditions. Ice and sleet accumulations from yesterday may remain on area roadways, although wintry precipitation has ended across the warned area. Additionally, black ice is possible this morning. There have been numerous reports of accidents, as well as, roads being closed or heavily impacted by icy conditions. Bitterly cold wind chills of 5 below zero to 10 above zero are expected through 9 AM this morning. * WHERE...Edwards Plateau, Hill Country, and I-35 corridor from New Braunfels to Georgetown, including Austin Metro. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult on untreated roads, especially elevated bridges, overpasses, and roadways. The hazardous conditions could impact this morning`s commute. Side walks and pavement will be slippery to walk on. In addition, the risk for hypothermia exists for those spending extended time outdoors and not dressed in layers and gloves.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state can be obtained at drivetexas.org. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors...make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
